body:
Problem:  'signcolumn' has incorrect "auto" width when moving
          a region with signs.
Solution: Invalidate the moved region in b_signcols.

comment_data.body: Using `curwin` here looks kind of weird but I think it's fine as this is only called with `curbuf` currently. So could also get rid of the `buf` argument I guess.
Don't remove this, because `make iwyu` will add it back.

This sounds like the typical which will hit us in the back of the head two years later when we least expect it. if the function depends on the window, it should take `win_T *` arg instead of buffer.

Alternatively, break out the part which is about other things than the actual marktree (to change.c or something like that), so this can keep only `MarkTree *` arg.

> Alternatively, break out the part which is about other things than the actual marktree (to change.c or something like that), so this can keep only MarkTree * arg.

That would require to dupe the find/move marks in the range logic. Or for `marktree_move_region()` to return/fill a passed in `kvec_t(MTPair)`. Either of those preferred to adding `win_T *`?
`win_T *` is fine for now. Then it at least is explicit what is going on (and we can clean it up later).

comment_regular_data.body: FWIW this is not a new bug, was also present pre-#26406. @bfredl are you okay with this? If so will need to take a look at the included headers in `marktree.c`. Currently `make lintc` complains even though it does compile successfully.
You need to include `buffer_defs.h` (with `IWYU pragma: keep`) in `marktree.h`.
Superseded by #26898 AFAIAC, although I am unsure if the splice behavior exhibited in this test case even correct. Should `:moving` a line from line 1 to line 2 affect the marks on line 3?
